740405-d-03-29-12-IC.Narrative: R90771-29 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF SWITCHING ARCHER DANIELS MIDLAND SOUTHERN COTTON OIL FACTORY. THE CREW HAD CALLED THE SOUTHERN COTTON OIL'S TRANSPORTATION COORDINATOR APPROXIMATELY 20 MINUTES PRIOR TOENTERING THE PLANT. THE CREW WAS CLEARED BY THE COORDINATOR TO ENTER THE PLANT AND HAD SHOVED INTOTRACK #2. THE CREW LINED THE PROPER ROUTE INTO THE PLANT AND SHOVED INTO THE PLANT AND COUPLED TO 8STANDING CARS. THEY WERE PULLING OUT OF THE PLANT ON TRACK 2 WHEN ADM'S TRACK MOBILE FAILED TO STOPSHORT ON TRACK 7 AND RAN INTO THE SIDE OF PROX 77120 ON R90771-28. THE ENGINEER NOTICED CARS STARTING TO DERAIL AND STOPPED THE MOVEMENT, DERAILED ON THE TRAIN WERE PROX 77120, NDYX 12555 AND CRGX 16339. THE TRACK MOBILE WENT INTO THE DITCH AND ADMX 23675 WAS DERAILED. THE OPERATOR OF THE TRACK MOBILE, ADM EMPLOYEE WAS REMOVED FROM SERVICE AND DRUG TESTED. NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED.

I031012-d-03-10-12-PATH.Narrative:
ON SATURDAY, MARCH 10, 2012, AN AUTOMATIC TRAIN CONTROL (ATC) WORK TRAIN, CONSIST: (VERMEER MACHINE72200-VERMEER MACHINE 14314- FLAT CAR 72512 - FLAT CAR 162 - FLAT CAR 163 - FLAT CAR 164 -FLAT CAR 15613 - FLAT CAR 72506 - VERMEER MACHINE 72205 - VERMEER MACHINE 14316) WAS ASSIGNED TO PERFORM ATC WORK IN SOUTH STREET YARD.  THIS EQUIPMENT IS OWNED AND OPERATED BY THE DIADONE ALDRIDGE JOINT VENTURE CONTRACTORS.  THERE WERE NO PATH EMPLOYEES EITHER OPERATING, OR DIRECTING ANY MOVEMENTS OF THIS CONSIST.

AT APPROXIMATELY 5:24 PM, THE CONSIST WAS MOVING WEST UP A GRADE ON TRACK H10, WHEN BOTH AXLES OF FLAT CAR 164 DERAILED TO THE SOUTH.  AS THE DERAILED CAR MOVED ALONG THE TRACK, THE WHEELS CONTACTED THE 3RD RAIL.  THE CONSIST CONTINUED TO MOVE ALONG THE RIGHT-OF-WAY FOR APPROXIMATELY 50 FEET BEFORE COMING TO A STOP.  AS A RESULT 300 FEET OF 3RD RAIL, AND SIGNAL L18X WERE DAMAGED.  

THERE WERE NO INJURIES AS A RESULT OF THIS INCIDENT.  DAMAGE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS INCIDENT, INCLUDING EQUIPMENT DAMAGE AND MAN POWER COSTS WERE- PS&C- $16,300.00; W&S $22,231.00.

SS&EM HAS DETERMINED THAT OPERATIONAL ERROR WAS THE PRIMARY CAUSAL FACTOR OF THIS DERAILMENT.  DURING THE TIME OFTHE ACCIDENT, EACH OPERATOR ABOARD EACH VERMEER MACHINE HAD CONTROL OF THE ACCELERATION AND BRAKINGOF HIS MACHINE IN THE CONSIST.  ALTHOUGH THEY COMMUNICATED VIA RA

IT WAS FOUND THAT THE CARS IN CC ROLLED INTO CARS THAT WERE SITTING IN THE FOUL ON MA02, TO BE SHOVED IN BY THE LEAD SHORTLY AFTER. IT WAS FOUND THAT THE BRAKEMAN FAILED TO PUT HANDBRAKES ON CARS TO INSURE EQUIPMENT DID NOT ROLL BACK INTO THE FOUL OF LEAD. CARS DAMAGED: CRGX 7354, NRLX 54183, MP 588640. 230995-d-03-31-12-SOO.Narrative: 298-28 WAS CLEARING THE MAIN LINE AT PLUMMER TO MEET A WESTBOUND. 298-28 DID NOT FIT IN THE SIDING SO THEY PULLED UP THE BEMIDJI SUB. THE LOCOMOTIVE & 7 CARS HAD PROCEEDED OVER HWY 59 CROSSING WHEN ASEMI TRUCK/TRAILER STRUCK THE 8TH CAR (TILX 290058 - BENZENE DICYLOPENTADIENE) RESULTING IN RELEASE(OF 28,000 GALLONS) & FIRE. TRUCK DRIVER SUSTAINED FATAL INJURIES, HAZMAT RELEASE/FIRE NECESSITATEDEVACUATION OF 292 PEOPLE IN APPROXIMATELY ONE MILE RADIUS (MOST OF THE TOWN OF PLUMMER, MN). RESIDENTS WERE ALLOWED TO RETURN HOME EARLY SATURDAY MORNING. NA 1993, FLAMMABLE LIQUID N.O.S. (BENZENE DICYLOPENTADIENE) CLASS 3. WAYBILL INDICATED NET MASS OF 87255 KG WHICH CONVERTS TO 87.255 METRIC TONS.
